definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: We need bonzi. Should buy out mcgrady's contract.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要棒子，我們應該買斷麥迪的合同。

sentences.english: The French government purchased the rights to the daguerreotype and released it free to the world.
sentences.chinese: 法國政府買斷並免費向世界公佈了此法。

sentences.english: They buy up controlling stakes in big companies, and raise profitability by improving corporate governance.
sentences.chinese: 他們買斷大公司的控股權，通過改進管理以獲利。

sentences.english: The introduction of outright repo presents both an opportunity and a challenge for banks.
sentences.chinese: 買斷式回購的推出，對銀行來說既是機遇又是挑戰。

sentences.english: In the years following the buyout, demand was greater than supply for burley tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 在買斷以後的歲月裏，白肋煙的需求遠大於供應。

definition: lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to be transferred to another post/to post away
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
